intro: Claoxylon langbiangense, commonly known as the Langbiang tree, is a rare and endemic species native to the Langbiang Plateau in Vietnam. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its unique, elongated leaves and distinctive floral structures. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments within montane forests. Its bark is thick and fissured, providing a protective layer against environmental stressors. Due to habitat loss and limited distribution, it is considered a vulnerable species requiring conservation efforts.
